content.description: Unnamed 5.7 left of crackerman. Crux was first move, easily linked to "Look No Hands." (Not in SDC Guidebook, on C. E. Hubbard topo on rockclimbing.com)
content.location: Right of Saladthe (5.10c) left of Crackerman (5.9)

content.description: This is the leftmost bolt line on Sundagger Wall.  Start at the right side of the moss and follow the slab to a right-slanting crack.  Climb up and left over the crack and continue up the slab.  High on the route there is a vertical crack on the right.  Either use the crack or stay to the left.  The crack offers opportunity for protection above the last bolt but the climbing is low angle and very easy at this point.  The anchor is just above a horizontal where the face steepens, to the left of the aforementioned crack.  Be aware that this climb is longer than half a 60m rope, even with standard rope stretch!  Tie a knot in the end before lowering; for top-roping and lowering the belayer should be to the climberÂ’s right to shorten the overall distance.
content.protection: 6 bolts + bolted chain rappel anchor. 6th bolt to anchor very run out (~15') but easy.

content.description: A nice contrast to the pumpy routes on patina wall, you have to rely more on your feet than your hands.  First crux halfway up and a second crux between the last bolt and the anchor.
content.protection: 10 bolts, two bolt rap anchor.  You can't make it down in a single rap with a single 60m rope, you have to use the midway anchor on the unknown 5.6 to the left.
content.location: Start about 10' right of the unknown 5.6 route.

content.description: Obvious hand-size crack up the center of the Sundagger Wall. Slightly flaring and highly textured, tape is strongly recommended. Start on a broad shelf, climb through a small bush and up a face past 3 bolts (5.7) to the crack.
content.protection: 3 bolts, Pro .4" to 3.5" Shares an anchor with Mac 10

content.description: Sustained hard 5.10 climbing that moves up and right past nine or ten bolts to a pair of shuts.
content.location: This route starts eight feet left of the anchors at the top of Crackerman, on the far east side of the ledge.

content.description: Move straight left from the anchor atop Crackerman (optional .5" gear before 1st bolt) for 12 feet, then up through slabby dishes to chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts, optional .5" gear at start, anchor chains
content.location: Above Crackerman, left of French Curve, right of Saladthe

content.description: Slab start to great features, goes up and slightly left, then back right up for a few fun lieback type moves. Shares anchor with Dancing on Dimes (11d)
content.location: Sundagger wall opposite Patina wall. Climb crackerman (5.9) to get to the base on a nice ledge. Climb starts from top of crackerman

content.description: Climb up and right on low angle ledges past 5 or 6 bolts. There are anchors on the east side of the big ledge.
content.protection: 6 bolts to bolted anchors on ledge.
content.location:
This route is on the east side of the north face of Sundagger and is a fun way to get up to the ledge and access some of the other routes.

Approach from the east (same as Patina Wall) and look for the bols moving up and right to the east side of the big ledge.
